DOC.brief_summary: Many service member suffer major limb amputation ( ) active duty seek return active duty . The purpose study determine biomechanic and/or bioenergtic difference exist popular multi-function prosthetic foot would facilitate return duty soldier amputation .
DOC.brief_title: Measures Gait Efficiency Three Multi-Axial , Vertical Shock Energy Storing-Return Prosthetic Feet During Simple & Complex Mobility Activities
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aims - Compare effectiveness popular prosthesis improve performance physically demand task environment . - Compare amputee performance group high-functioning non-amputees determine performance difference group . Hypotheses : Prosthetic foot shock absorb torsional feature perform good field activity . Prosthetic foot high energy return low mass perform well treadmill run . Non-amputee control demonstrate superior performance outcome field laboratory environment compare amputee subject . Relevance : This study potential quantify difference highly mobile amputee non-amputees . Additionally , provide objective measure different prosthesis may enhance mobility soldier amputation . The study compare laboratory field measure indicate condition increase efficiency prosthesis rapidly change mobility demand . This potential permit retention already trained soldier .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria ( Amputees ) : Unilateral transtibial amputee ambulate K4 prosthesis > 1yr K4 functional level Currently active duty military uniformed service ( e.g . police ) , recently separate Veteran , strong highperformance athletic history amputee ( e.g . rank triathlete , paralympian , etc . ) Schedule availability willingness comply study protocol Aged < 45 year Medical clearance , within last 6 month , participation vigorous physical activity Inclusion Criteria ( Nonamputees ) Currently active duty military , ROTC , uniformed service ( e.g . police ) recently separate Veteran , highly accomplished recreational athlete ( e.g . marathoner ) Schedule availability willingness comply study protocol Aged < 45 year Medical clearance , within last 6 month , participation vigorous physical activity
